title: She Paid R. Kelly's $100,000 Bail, But Now Wants the Money Back. A Chicago Judge Says That's Not Happening
text:
She Paid R. Kelly's $100,000 Bail, But Now Wants the Money Back. A Chicago Judge Says That's Not Happening

R. Kelly appears at a hearing before Judge Lawrence Flood at Leighton Criminal Court Building May 7, 2019 in Chicago, Illinois.

R. Kelly appears at a hearing before Judge Lawrence Flood at Leighton Criminal Court Building May 7, 2019 in Chicago, Illinois. E. Jason Wambsgans—Getty Images

(CHICAGO) — A judge in R. Kelly's Illinois sexual assault case has refused to give $100,000 in bail money back to a Kelly friend who paid it in February to secure the singer's release from county jail.

The judge says papers that Valencia Love signed clearly indicated she could lose the money.

Love's lawyer John Collins said in court Tuesday that she didn't know when she paid 10% of a $1 million bond that Kelly would be charged federally and land in federal jail. Collins said Love now fears losing all the money as charges against Kelly stack up.

But Judge Lawrence Flood read sections of papers Love signed warning the bond money could be used for Kelly's legal fees and that she may never see it again.
description: Judge Lawrence Flood says papers that Valencia Love signed clearly indicated she could lose the money, after a petition from her lawyer
